body_html: @yifeif @jart we set the DSO_CUDA_VERSION from the CUDA lib, but apparently the profiler tools can have a different version. (the DSO_CUDA_VERSION is used to load both cuda lib and cupti). Since ubuntu 16.04 is the primary version for us, it should work out of the box. Should we configure to split the versions?
body_text: @yifeif @jart we set the DSO_CUDA_VERSION from the CUDA lib, but apparently the profiler tools can have a different version. (the DSO_CUDA_VERSION is used to load both cuda lib and cupti). Since ubuntu 16.04 is the primary version for us, it should work out of the box. Should we configure to split the versions?
body: @yifeif @jart we set the `DSO_CUDA_VERSION` from the CUDA lib, but apparently the profiler tools can have a different version. (the `DSO_CUDA_VERSION` is used to load both cuda lib and cupti). Since ubuntu 16.04 is the primary version for us, it should work out of the box. Should we `configure` to split the versions?
